name: Chicken Dopiaza
history: Chicken Dopiaza is a popular Indian dish, known for its prominent use of onions. 'Do Pyaza' literally means 'two onions' in Hindi, referring to the large quantity of onions used at different stages of cooking.
description: Chicken Dopiaza is a flavorful curry dish where chicken is cooked with a generous amount of onions, creating a rich and aromatic gravy. It often includes bell peppers, tomatoes, and a variety of spices, offering a balance of sweet and spicy flavors.

instructions.title: SautÃ© Onions and Spices
instructions.description: Heat oil in a pan. Add finely chopped onions and ginger-garlic paste, cooking until the onions are golden brown. Stir in turmeric powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, and red chili powder.

instructions.title: Cook the Chicken
instructions.description: Add chicken pieces to the pan. Cook until the chicken is browned.

instructions.title: Add Vegetables
instructions.description: Add sliced onions, bell peppers, and tomatoes. Cook until the vegetables are soft.

instructions.title: Simmer the Curry
instructions.description: Add water to achieve the desired consistency. Bring to a boil, then simmer until the chicken is fully cooked.

instructions.title: Finish with Garam Masala
instructions.description: Stir in garam masala. Cook for a few more minutes.

instructions.title: Garnish and Serve
instructions.description: Garnish with chopped cilantro. Serve hot with rice or Indian bread like roti or naan.

tips: Cook the onions until they are well browned for a richer flavor.
Adjust the amount of chili powder to suit your taste for spiciness.
variations: Add a splash of cream or coconut milk for a richer gravy.
Include other vegetables like carrots or peas for added nutrition.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 3 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat on the stove or in a microwave until hot.
presentationTips: Serve in a traditional Indian serving dish, garnished with a lemon wedge.
Pair with a cool cucumber salad or raita.
